channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: 400-year old sunken warships aren’t the sisters of doomed Vasa after all
item.description: Wood analysis shows the wrecks discovered in 2019 are the warships Apollo and Maria

item.title: Biden admin wants to bring sexy back with dating app vaccination statuses
item.description: Amid giggles, US officials dish on dating app vaccinations badges, super swipes.

item.title: Apple CEO faces tough questioning as Epic Games trial wraps up
item.description: Judge Rogers: “It doesn’t seem to me you feel any pressure or competition…”

item.title: Seagate’s new Mach.2 is the world’s fastest conventional hard drive
item.description: The Exos Mach.2 is only “available to select customers” for now.

item.title: The new iPad Pro, iMac, Apple TV 4K, and Siri Remote are now available
item.description: These aren’t pre-orders anymore, but ship dates have already slipped a bit.

item.title: Epic’s “Mega Sale” returns with tons of discounts on notable PC games
item.description: Dealmaster also has deals on Roku streamers, Apple’s Mac Mini, and iPads.

item.title: Brain implant gives robotic arm a sense of touch
item.description: Being able to tell what you’re grasping gives a big boost to performance.

item.title: Crypto payments above $10,000 would be reported to IRS under Treasury plan
item.description: Fear of crypto being used for tax evasion drives Biden admin’s reporting plan.

item.title: Ohio’s 53% vaccination surge tied to $1M lottery; NY and MD announce lotteries
item.description: Biden admin “enthusiastic” about cash-for-vax promotions, which appear effective.

item.title: More detailed Pixel 6 renders show off camera design, display specs
item.description: OnLeaks reveals screen sizes, wireless charging, and some camera details.

item.title: Epic Games v. Apple by the numbers: Fortnite is worth that much money?
item.description: Court proceedings unmask the business realities behind iOS gaming and Fortnite.

item.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook to take stand in Epic/Apple trial today
item.description: Epic Games, the maker of Fortnite, has called the Apple chief to testify.

item.title: Archaeologists train a neural network to sort pottery fragments for them
item.description: The network turned out to be as good at the job as human archaeologists.

item.title: Texas gov knew of natural gas shortages days before blackout, blamed wind anyway
item.description: Official’s phone logs offer blow-by-blow account of the disaster as it unfolded.

item.title: No Man’s Sky confirms Mass Effect crossover, adds iconic Normandy SR-1 to fleet
item.description: The SR-1 can be yours, if you find it in-game by May 31. Also: NMS’s DLSS-VR tease.

item.title: Vulnerabilities in billions of Wi-Fi devices let hackers bypass firewalls
item.description: FragAttacks let hackers inject malicious code or commands into encrypted Wi-Fi traffic.

item.title: The Ferrari Portofino M, reviewed
item.description: We engage in a little spot of grand touring in Ferrari’s entry-level GT.

item.title: Rocket Report: A new space race in India, Elon’s hat is safe for now
item.description: “This is not the time to cut corners on environmental review.”

item.title: What mimes can teach us about visual perception
item.description: Mimes “make us feel like we’re aware of an object just by seeming to interact with it.”

item.title: Snap debuts true AR glasses that show the potential (and limitations) of AR
item.description: Limited availability, battery life, and FOV make for a curiosity, not a product.

item.title: Google announces its first-ever physical retail store
item.description: Google’s New York City Campus will be home to its first retail store, at 15th and 9th.

item.title: Need for annual COVID shots may hinge on how many get vaccinated now, Fauci says
item.description: In new interviews, Fauci discusses the future of COVID-19 vaccinations.

item.title: Microsoft is (finally) killing off Internet Explorer entirely
item.description: Internet Explorer lives on in Edge IE Mode, LTSC Windows 10, and Windows Server.

item.title: Mandatory opt-out, data breach notification part of new privacy bill
item.description: Senators reintroduce bill as scrutiny of social media ramps up.

item.title: Chrome’s RSS-powered “Follow” button is like a rebooted Google Reader
item.description: For now, it’s an Android “experiment” that might get “a broader rollout in Chrome.”

item.title: We drove the Audi RS e-tron GT for an hour; here’s what we learned
item.description: Ars got to spend some time with a preproduction car in Virginia.

item.title: Frontier knowingly sold Internet speeds it can’t deliver, FTC lawsuit says
item.description: Frontier capped actual DSL speeds to levels below its advertised rates, FTC says.

item.title: Pfizer’s COVID vaccine can stay in normal fridge for up to a month, FDA says
item.description: Change extends fridge storage from 5 days to a month—significantly aiding logistics.

item.title: What PlayStation’s “monopoly” lawsuits get wrong about digital game sales
item.description: Adding download options from traditional retailers doesn’t seem to affect prices.

item.title: This is Ford’s first electric pickup truck, the F-150 Lightning
item.description: The standard-range electric F-150 will start at just under $40,000 before tax credits.

item.title: Android 12 at Google I/O: Hints of the redesign in the beta, lots of news
item.description: Google I/O features a big Android info dump, but not much working code right now.

item.title: Before ruining millions of vaccines, Emergent failed inspections, raked in cash
item.description: Tens of millions of J�J and AstraZeneca doses are still in limbo.

item.title: Review: The Nevers makes abrupt turn in disorienting midseason finale
item.description: We briefly wondered if HBO Max was accidentally airing an entirely different series

item.title: Apple rolls out a slew of new accessibility features to iPhone, Watch, and more
item.description: New services include sign-language tech support and more.

item.title: 4 vulnerabilities under attack give hackers full control of Android devices
item.description: Google updates a 2-week-old security bulletin to say some vulnerabilities were 0-days.

item.title: Semiconductor shortages continue to worsen, causing record order delays
item.description: Automakers are expecting $110 billion in lost sales this year due to shortages.

item.title: AT&T overcharged Washington, DC, for 5 years, must pay $1.5 million, AG says
item.description: DC announces $1.5M settlement after alleging AT�T “knowingly” violated contract.

item.title: HBO Max with ads: $10/mo starting in June, and guess what it won’t include
item.description: Similar to Hulu’s price options; other stream-with-ads options are much less.

item.title: This is Kia’s next electric car: The 300-mile EV6
item.description: It is the first Kia to use the brand’s new 800-volt platform for electric cars.

item.title: Want improved fast travel in Skyward Sword HD? Buy this $25 Amiibo!
item.description: Other Switch games also hide some key gameplay features behind figurines.

item.title: Someone has bid more than $2 million for the first New Shepard seat
item.description: The bidding will culminate in a live auction on June 12.

item.title: Bitcoin bubble bursts overnight, dragging down stocks
item.description: After stunning run-up over the past year, cryptocurrencies are tanking.

item.title: 2021 iPad Pro review: More of the same—but way, way faster thanks to M1
item.description: It’s the Marvel movie sequel of Apple products: The same formula but bigger.

item.title: Shake-up reported at the CDC; two high-profile officials depart
item.description: Recent hiccups reportedly led to tensions within the agency.

item.title: 20 percent of Switch sales now going to households that already had a Switch
item.description: Miyamoto wants a Switch “not just [for] every family, but [for] every single person.”

item.title: Rare quasicrystal found in trinitite formed during 1945 Trinity Test
item.description: Research suggests other quasicrystals might form in lighting strikes, meteor impacts.

item.title: Google, Samsung, and Fitbit team up to save Wear OS
item.description: Samsung is bringing the hardware, Google is bringing the software.

item.title: Verizon forces users onto pricier plans to get $50-per-month gov’t subsidy
item.description: You might have to change Internet plans to get the FCC’s $50 low-income subsidy.

item.title: Indigenous forest gardens remain productive and diverse for over a century
item.description: Gardens persist for 150 years after those who planted them were removed.

item.title: Climate change is erasing humanity’s oldest art
item.description: Climate change is speeding up the process of erosion, according to a recent study.

item.title: Today’s best tech deals: Roku media streamers, Apple iPad Air, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also has deals on Xbox Game Pass Ultimate, SSDs, and LG OLED TVs.

item.title: Florida water plant compromise came hours after worker visited malicious site
item.description: Researchers find watering-hole attack targeting water utilities.

item.title: All fossil fuel exploration needs to end this year, IEA says
item.description: Renewable spending needs to double to $4 trillion per year by 2030.

item.title: Google shows off Android 12’s huge UI overhaul
item.description: Google confirms Android 12’s color-changing UI, all-new design.

item.title: Intel’s Optane H20 is the latest attempt at “hybrid” laptop storage
item.description: H20 benchmarks well, but real-world performance and price remain to be seen.

item.title: Compromised credentials? Google can now change website passwords for you
item.description: Google Duplex will soon navigate the “change password” interface of websites.

item.title: Nvidia will add anti-mining flags to the rest of its RTX 3000 GPU series
item.description: Company says it learned from RTX 3060 fiasco, but is “LHR” just antivirus for GPUs?

item.title: Researchers show neutralizing antibodies correlate with COVID protection
item.description: Antibodies produced by vaccines and infections declined at roughly similar rates.

item.title: Apple planning MacBook Pro with 16-core GPU, Mac Pro with 128 GPU cores
item.description: Bloomberg’s sources spill core counts and more on the next wave of Macs.

item.title: Another media acquisition? This one would involve Amazon, MGM, and ~$9B
item.description: Does this at least mean we can watch No Time to Die at home soon?

item.title: McLaren goes with a clean-sheet chassis and engine for Artura supercar
item.description: There’s a new carbon-fiber monocoque and a 120-degree V6.

item.title: Demeo is the best multiplayer, virtual-reality D&D clone ever made
item.description: Issues aside, it already feels like sharing a real-life dice-and-minis table with friends.

item.title: Biden pledges to share 20 million COVID-19 vaccine doses with the world
item.description: The 20 million will be in addition to 60 million AstraZeneca doses already pledged.

item.title: Apple’s M1 is a fast CPU—but M1 Macs feel even faster due to QoS
item.description: Howard Oakley did an excellent deep dive on M1 scheduling and performance.

item.title: Apple Music subscribers will get lossless and spatial audio for free next month
item.description: New features will launch with iOS 14.6, macOS 11.4 in June.

item.title: Rocket Lab reviewing data after its second Electron failure in a year
item.description: “We deeply regret the loss of BlackSky’s payload.”

item.title: CDC defends its abrupt reversal on masks after backlash from experts
item.description: Experts question timing as CDC director says public pressure wasn’t a factor.

item.title: AT&T to spin off WarnerMedia, basically admitting giant merger was a mistake
item.description: WarnerMedia and Discovery to merge, and standalone AT�T will focus on broadband.

item.title: Forget multiple cameras—Sharp phone has one giant 1-inch camera sensor
item.description: It’s the biggest smartphone camera sensor ever—or at least tied.

item.title: City pays $350,000 after suing “hackers” for opening Dropbox link it sent them
item.description: Employee mistakenly sent the link when replying to a records request.

item.title: It’s not enough to trust science on vaccines—others have to as well
item.description: Personal trust and societal consensus have an additive effect.

item.title: Why Roblox’s definition of “games” is key to the Epic vs. Apple case
item.description: The line between “game” and “experience” has major implications for iOS App Review.

item.title: From apes to birds, there are 65 animal species that “laugh”
item.description: Laughter is spread widely across mammals and occurs in birds, too.

item.title: A brief look at electric vehicles from the dawn of the automobile age
item.description: Electric vehicles were well represented during the early decades of the car.
